definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Yet the superstore trend is relatively new to China.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在中國大賣場是相對新的發展潮流。

sentences.english: Moreover, fads and fashions come and go.
sentences.chinese: 而且，時尚和潮流總是來來去去，變化不定。
通常，萬聖節服裝會折射出流行文化的潮流趨勢。

sentences.english: As can be seen from the cartoon, nowadays many people follow the hen and swarm into the tide of promise-making.
sentences.chinese: 從圖中看出，現如今很多人跟隨潮流，信奉承諾制。

sentences.english: The course will discuss the concept of regional economic integration.
sentences.chinese: 區域經濟整合已爲世界潮流，本課程將加以研析。

sentences.english: Although this follows a global trend, it can take some time.
sentences.chinese: 雖然這順應了一場全球性的潮流，但它仍需要時間。

sentences.english: How can anyone be expected to resist the tide, the torrent of competing images?
sentences.chinese: 任何一個人怎樣才能抵制這種潮流，競爭物象的潮流。

sentences.english: How can anyone be expected to resist the tide, the torrent of competing images?
sentences.chinese: 任何一個人怎樣才能抵制這種潮流，競爭物象的潮流。

sentences.english: Reform is a prevailing trend in today's world.
sentences.chinese: 變革是當今世界的潮流。

sentences.english: Unique design, comprihensive top furniture supermarket, leading the new fashion of furniture consumption.
sentences.chinese: 匠心獨具，百貨式高端家居賣場，引領消費新潮流。

sentences.english: This stream refreshes the pool of minimally literate Americans.
sentences.chinese: 這個潮流使得讀寫能力最低的美國人大量增加。

sentences.english: The trend that the off-trade capital enters the business of newspaper has attracted more and more attention of news media.
sentences.chinese: 業外資本進入報業的潮流日益引起新聞媒體界的關注。

sentences.english: How does a stroller's dress and hairdo become fashionable?
sentences.chinese: 一個流浪漢的衣着和髮型怎麼成潮流的？

sentences.english: Clothing has always been subject to change based on the dictates of fashion and whims.
sentences.chinese: 衣着往往隨着時尚潮流的趨勢和心血來潮而發生變化。

sentences.english: It is therefore an unstoppable tide of history.
sentences.chinese: 因此，它是一個不可阻擋的歷史潮流。

sentences.english: The trend of Chinese literature experienced a sudden change. Narrating in colloquial language replaced chanting in classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 中國文學潮流遭遇了急變，白話敘事替代文言詠歎。

definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to keep up with the latest fashion

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
old-fashioned/out of date/to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
